intro: Seriola saldensis, commonly known as the Saldensis mackerel, is a marine fish species belonging to the family Scombridae. It is characterized by its streamlined body, which is adapted for swift swimming in open ocean environments. The fish typically has a silver-blue coloration with a metallic sheen, which helps in camouflage within its natural habitat. It is found in temperate and tropical waters of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Botanically, while it is not a plant, it plays an important ecological role in marine ecosystems as a predator and prey species.
